metadata.title: CVE-2015-8854 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
The marked package before 0.3.4 for Node.js allows attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via unspecified vectors that trigger a "catastrophic backtracking issue for the em inline rule," aka a "regular expression denial of service (ReDoS)."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2015-8854` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjs-marked - 0.3.9+dfsg-1
node-marked - 0.3.9+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: node-marked package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.3.9+dfsg-1').
